channel.title: Yeah, call me a noob :p
channel.description:
I've been here since 2006, released like 8 tutorials on private servers back then.. haven't coded in YEARS. Now I feel like a noob because...
I can't even connect to a server from a client. Trying to just connect to my computer for now with 127.0.0.1 and getting "Error connecting to server"...yeah...I feel dumb when I used to code java and now I can't even connect to a server with a client.
I'm using Hybriid PVP blank source+client. I've edited client.java to find 127.0.0.1. Am I doing something wrong =P

item.title: Yeah, call me a noob :p
item.dc:creator: @Slyte Slyte
item.description:
@Slyte wrote:

LOL yeah ok I’m not a noob with Java. I’m more into PHP mysql, but java is funner than coding a text based RPG.
Here’s why I’m a noob, when you haven’t dealt with RSPS’s for 7 years, you kinda forget that just MAYBE you have to run the client and run the server? Lmfao, problem fixed -.-

arham 4:

No. Just run both of them.

Read full topic

item.title: Yeah, call me a noob :p
item.dc:creator: @luna-scape luna-scape
item.description:
@luna-scape wrote:

I don’t think ur ports have to be open if ur localhosting lol recheck ur client.java or gui.java and do ctrl+f and search for no-ip or maybe it was hosted on a vps ip before snd you have to change that id?

Read full topic

item.title: Yeah, call me a noob :p
item.dc:creator: @Slyte Slyte
item.description:
@Slyte wrote:

I’ve portforwarded 43594, the port is open.
I’ve disabled windows firewall, anti-virus programs and my rotuers firewall.
I’ve been using moparscape 4.0 webclient to test connecting to a server for the time being.
I cannot connect to localhost on any ports, 80, 5555, 43594.
I don’t understand how I can’t connect to my localhost lol…
I’ve called my ISP they can’t tell me much other than “You should be able to connect to your local machine”

I don’t understand this… btw,
when I portforward port 80, I get connection timed out.
Shouldn’t port 80 be open?

I’ve done everything I can. I can’t connect to my no-ip.org, hamachi or localhost.
I can connect to other RSPS though, I do play a few of them and can connect fine.
What could be causing this problem?

I’ll connect through my LAN in the morning and see if it makes a difference.

Read full topic

item.title: Yeah, call me a noob :p
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote=“The Web Guy, post:15, topic:475556”]Kid, learn to spell, your argument is invalid.
Either way, correct spelling or not, your information is in-accurate.
If you don’t know what you’re talking about, don’t try to help someone.[/quote]

If you’re not going to post solely to answer the OP, then don’t post and derail the thread.

Read full topic

item.title: Yeah, call me a noob :p
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

[quote=“Projectkingdom, post:13, topic:475556”]I never “tked lik dis” retard

"Just answer his f***ing question u idiot

and to your answer mate -

You need to portfoward first, portfoward the port 43594

I can give u a router portfoward guide if you post your router model here

Also are u using PI or Delta e.t.c?"
the only thing i see there were i was “tlking like dis” was when i said u -_____-

[quote author=The Web Guy link=topic=593674.msg4187504#msg4187504 date=1356375441]

Just answer his f***ing question u idiot

and to your answer mate -

You need to portfoward first, portfoward the port 43594

I can give u a router portfoward guide if you post your router model here

Also are u using PI or Delta e.t.c?

If you wrote eight tutorials in 2006, you should know this, no matter how many years it’s been…

Not true… I believe if they were really bad tutorials. they dont count. Lol

You really shouldn’t be calling someone an idiot if you ‘tlk lik dis u idit’, how does that sound, buddy? And also, this isn’t a port-forwarding problem, idiot. This can happen because the server is listening on a port other than the port that the client is trying to connect to. You don’t need to port-forward with-in localhost/127.0.0.1/0.0.0.0 … Meaning, the server is listening on port 43594 and the client is trying to connect to 5555.
[/quote][/quote]

Kid, learn to spell, your argument is invalid.
Either way, correct spelling or not, your information is in-accurate.
If you don’t know what you’re talking about, don’t try to help someone.

Read full topic
